result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Martel Polk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 9 days RCJ in lieu of payment of costs, consecutive to sentence, concurrent with other cases.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Martel Polk

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Institution (10-18-2018)

Defendant Patrick Martel Polk in court in custody with attorney Joshua Klaff.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders 1 year RCJ, concurrent with 16CF1761, 17CF822, 17CF1056, 9 days RCJ in lieu of payment of costs, consecutive to sentence, concurrent with other cases, 104 days sentence credit.
